THE first person who died from the coronavirus in the U.S. passed from a ruptured heart caused by her bodys effort to defeat the virus, according to her autopsy.
Patricia Dowd, a 57-year-old from California, died on February 6 far earlier than the February 2… [+2840 chars]

articles.title: Oregon coronavirus death toll reaches 91 as statewide cases surpass 2,300 - KATU
articles.description: PORTLAND, Ore. – Four more people have died in Oregon from COVID-19, health officials said Sunday as the state’s total number of identified coronavirus cases climbs to 2,311 patients. So far, 91 people have died in Oregon related to the coronaviru…

articles.title: Many failures combined to unleash death on Italy's Lombardy region - Alabama's News Leader
articles.description: ROME (AP) — As Italy prepares to emerge from the West’s first and most extensive coronavirus lockdown, it is increasingly clear that something went terribly wrong in Lombardy, the hardest-hit region in Europe’s hardest-hit country. Italy had…

articles.title: Pulse oximeters: What to know about whether you need one - msnNOW
articles.description: Sales and search interest in the medical devices, which measure the saturation of oxygen in red blood cells, have spiked in recent weeks.
articles.content:
Many patients with severe cases of Covid-19 have been shown to have extremely low levels of oxygen in the blood. Others who have tested positive find themselves experiencing shortness of breath.

articles.title: Why was the 1918 influenza pandemic so deadly? - SILive.com
articles.description: Medical conditions of the day, plus World War I, were big factors.
articles.content:
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. Influenza simply isnt supposed to be all that deadly.
But the flu pandemic that broke out in the fall of 1918 killed so many people that overall life expectancy in many places around the world was actually diminished.
When all was said a… [+1084 chars]
